column1: Euless ( YOO-liss) is a city in Tarrant County
column2: Texas
column4: and a suburb of Dallas and Fort Worth. Euless is part of the Mid-Cities region between Dallas and Fort Worth. The city's population was 51
column5: 277 as of the 2010 census.The southwestern portion of Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport is inside the city limits of Euless.

column1: Euless is named after Elisha Adam Euless
column2: a native of Tennessee who moved to Texas in 1867 and later bought 170 acres (0.69 km2) of land on the current intersection of North Main St. and West Euless Boulevard. Euless started a cotton gin and a community center on his property and quickly became a prominent figure among other settlers. He was eventually elected county sheriff
column4: after which Euless retired for health reasons. The community developed around the land Euless owned
column5: and the locals decided to name the city in honor of him.

column1: Arbor Daze is a celebration of trees. It is usually held in the municipal complex on the last weekend of April from Saturday to Sunday. During Arbor Daze there is a business tent
column2: an art tent and two concert stages
column3: as well as a kids' tent called Kidz Zone. Parking is available anywhere in the municipal complex or at the nearby church
column4: First Baptist Euless.The Arbor Daze festival has received over 47 awards and recognitions for excellent programs and publications
column5: making it one of the most decorated festivals in Texas.

column6: and Colleyville Heritage High School.  Euless also includes Harmony Science Academy

column1: The football team of Euless's Trinity High School has achieved national notoriety for its pre-game and post-game ritual dance
column2: the New Zealand Māori Ka Mate haka
column3: started by several players of Tongan descent. The team won 5A Division 1 state football championships in 2005
column5: and 2009 and was featured in an EA Sports commercial in 2010.
